required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PREG - Offspring: Investigation of Children From Mothers With and Without Gestational Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: PREG-Offspring: Untersuchung Von Kindern Von Teilnehmerinnen Der Deutschen Studie Gestationsdiabetes (PREG-Studie)

brief_summary.textblock: Gestational diabetes is the most common complication during pregrancy. With a screening between week 24 and 28 of gestation women with gestational diabetes can be identified and treated. Treatment comprises modification of diet and in some cases taking medication. This treatment lowers undesirable events like macrosomia or premature birth. However, unitl gestational diabetes is diagnosed the fetus is exposed to increased intrauterine glucose levels. The long-term effects of a well-managed gestational diabetes on the development of the offspring is still not well understood. Therefore, the PREG - Offspring study investigates several aspects of development in children from healthy and gestational diabetes mothers until adulthood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in body height from birth to age 6, 10, 14 and 17
primary_outcome.description: Body height is measured with a tape measure in centimeter (cm)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in body weight from birth to age 6, 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight is measured with a scale in kilogram (kg)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of body fat from age 6 to age 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: Body fat content is measured with bioimpedance anaylsis in percent (%)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of blood pressure from age 6 to age 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is measured with a blood pressure monitor as systolic and diastolic pressure in millimeter mercury column (mm Hg)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of pubertal development scale from age 6 to age 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: Pubertal development scale is assessed according to Tanner stages

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of blood glucose from age 6 to age 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose is measured in blood sample in miligram per deciliter (mg/dl)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of HbA1C from age 6 to age 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1C is measured in blood sample in percent (%)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of cardiometabolic risk markers from age 6 to 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: Cholesterol, Low-density Lipoprotein, High-density Lipoprotein, Triglycerides, Lipoprotein(a) are measured in blood sample in mg/dl

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of blood glucose from age 6 to age 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: 24h glucose profiles and postprandial glycemic excursions (AUC) will be measured by flash glucose monitoring

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of activity level from age 6 to 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: Activity level is assessed with the MOMO activity questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of magnetic resonance images from age 6 to 10, 14 and 17
secondary_outcome.description: Distribution of whole body fat and visceral and subcutaneous fat confirmed by MR-Imaging and proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy by 3T Whole Body Imager

clinical_study.condition: Offspring Exposed to GDM and Control

intervention.intervention_name: intrauterine exposure to elevated glucose levels
intervention.description: intrauterine exposure to elevated glucose levels

study_pop.textblock: Study participants are children from mothers that are enrolled in the PREG study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- signed informed consent provided by child and parent
- documented oral glucose tolerance test of the mother during pregnancy
- adequate management of gestational diabetes until birth
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe malformation that makes an examination impossible
- existent of coagulation disorder with increased risk of bleeding after blood sampling
